verses.verse: And Jacob <WH3290> lifted <WH5375> up his eyes, <WH5869> and looked, <WH7200> and, behold, <WH2009> Esau <WH6215> came, <WH935> and with him four <WH702> hundred <WH3967> men. <WH376> And he divided <WH2673> the children <WH3206> to Leah, <WH3812> and to Rachel, <WH7354> and to the two <WH8147> handmaids. <WH8198>

And he put <WH7760> the handmaids <WH8198> and their children <WH3206> foremost, <WH7223> and Leah <WH3812> and her children <WH3206> after, <WH314> and Rachel <WH7354> and Joseph <WH3130> last. <WH314>

And he passed <WH5674> over <WH5674> before <WH6440> them, and bowed <WH7812> himself to the ground <WH776> seven <WH7651> times, <WH6471> until <WH5704> he came <WH5066> near <WH5066> to his brother. <WH251>
And Esau <WH6215> ran <WH7323> to meet <WH7125> him, and embraced <WH2263> him, and fell <WH5307> on <WH5921> his neck, <WH6677> and kissed <WH5401> him: and they wept. <WH1058>

And he lifted <WH5375> up his eyes, <WH5869> and saw <WH7200> the women <WH802> and the children; <WH3206> and said, <WH559> Who <WH4310> are those <WH428> with you? And he said, <WH559> The children <WH3206> which <WH834> God <WH430> has graciously <WH2603> given <WH2603> your servant. <WH5650>
Then the handmaidens <WH8198> came <WH5066> near, <WH5066> they and their children, <WH3206> and they bowed <WH7812> themselves.

And Leah <WH3812> also <WH1571> with her children <WH3206> came <WH5066> near, <WH5066> and bowed <WH7812> themselves: and after <WH310> came <WH5066> Joseph <WH3130> near <WH5066> and Rachel, <WH7354> and they bowed <WH7812> themselves.

And he said, <WH559> What <WH4310> mean you by all <WH3605> this <WH2088> drove <WH4264> which <WH834> I met? <WH6298> And he said, <WH559> These are to find <WH4672> grace <WH2580> in the sight <WH5869> of my lord. <WH113>
And Esau <WH6215> said, <WH559> I have <WH3426> enough, <WH7227> my brother; <WH251> keep <WH1961> that you have to yourself.

And Jacob <WH3290> said, <WH559> No, <WH408> I pray <WH4994> you, if <WH518> now <WH4994> I have found <WH4672> grace <WH2580> in your sight, <WH5869> then receive <WH3947> my present <WH4503> at my hand: <WH3027> for therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> I have seen <WH7200> your face, <WH6440> as though I had seen <WH7200> the face <WH6440> of God, <WH430> and you were pleased <WH7521> with me.

Take, <WH3947> I pray <WH4994> you, my blessing <WH1293> that is brought <WH935> to you; because <WH3588> God <WH430> has dealt graciously <WH2603> with me, and because <WH3588> I have <WH3426> enough. <WH3605> And he urged <WH6484> him, and he took <WH3947> it.
And he said, <WH559> Let us take our journey, <WH5265> and let us go, <WH3212> and I will go <WH3212> before <WH5048> you.

And he said <WH559> to him, My lord <WH113> knows <WH3045> that the children <WH3206> are tender, <WH7390> and the flocks <WH6629> and herds <WH1241> with young <WH5763> are with me: and if <WH518> men should overdrive <WH1849> them one <WH259> day, <WH3117> all <WH3605> the flock <WH6629> will die. <WH4191>

Let my lord, <WH113> I pray <WH4994> you, pass <WH5674> over <WH5674> before <WH6440> his servant: <WH5650> and I will lead <WH5095> on softly, <WH328> according <WH7272> as the cattle <WH4399> that goes before <WH6440> me and the children <WH3206> be able <WH7272> to endure, <WH7272> until <WH5704> I come <WH935> to my lord <WH113> to Seir. <WH8165>

And Esau <WH6215> said, <WH559> Let me now <WH4994> leave <WH3322> with you some of the folk <WH5971> that are with me. And he said, <WH559> What <WH4100> needs it? let me find <WH4672> grace <WH2580> in the sight <WH5869> of my lord. <WH113>
So Esau <WH6215> returned <WH7725> that day <WH3117> on his way <WH1870> to Seir. <WH8165>

And Jacob <WH3290> journeyed <WH5265> to Succoth, <WH5523> and built <WH1129> him an house, <WH1004> and made <WH6213> booths <WH5521> for his cattle: <WH4735> therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> the name <WH8034> of the place <WH4725> is called <WH7121> Succoth. <WH5523>

And Jacob <WH3290> came <WH935> to Shalem, <WH8003> a city <WH5892> of Shechem, <WH7927> which <WH834> is in the land <WH776> of Canaan, <WH3667> when he came <WH935> from Padanaram; <WH6307> and pitched <WH2583> his tent before <WH854> <WH6440> the city. <WH5892>

And he bought <WH7069> a parcel <WH2513> of a field, <WH7704> where <WH834> he had spread <WH5186> his tent, <WH168> at the hand <WH3027> of the children <WH1121> of Hamor, <WH2544> Shechem's <WH7927> father, <WH1> for an hundred <WH3967> pieces of money. <WH7192>
And he erected <WH5324> there <WH8033> an altar, <WH4196> and called <WH7121> it Elelohe Israel. <WH415>
